001package com.technototes.library.structure;
002
003import com.qualcomm.hardware.lynx.LynxModule;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode;
005import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.ElapsedTime;
006import com.technototes.library.command.CommandScheduler;
007import com.technototes.library.control.CommandGamepad;
008import com.technototes.library.hardware2.HardwareBuilder;
009import com.technototes.library.logger.Logger;
010import java.util.List;
011
012/**
013 * Class for command based op modes
014 *
015 * @author Alex Stedman
016 */
017public abstract class CommandOpMode extends LinearOpMode {
018
019    /**
020     * Command gamepad objects
021     */
022    public CommandGamepad driverGamepad, codriverGamepad;
023
024    private ElapsedTime opModeTimer = new ElapsedTime();
025
026    private OpModeState opModeState = OpModeState.INIT;
027
028    private Logger logger;
029
030    private List<LynxModule> hubs;
031
032    private boolean terminated = false;
033
034    /**
035     * Get op mode state
036     *
037     * @return Current op mode state
038     */
039    public OpModeState getOpModeState() {
040        return opModeState;
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Get the op mode's logger
045     *
046     * @return The logger
047     */
048    public Logger getLogger() {
049        return logger;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Get the opmode runtime
054     *
055     * @return Runtime in seconds
056     */
057    public double getOpModeRuntime() {
058        return opModeTimer.seconds();
059    }
060
061    @Override
062    public final void runOpMode() {
063        opModeState = OpModeState.INIT;
064        CommandScheduler.resetScheduler().setOpMode(this);
065        hubs = hardwareMap.getAll(LynxModule.class);
066        hubs.forEach(e -> e.setBulkCachingMode(LynxModule.BulkCachingMode.MANUAL));
067        HardwareBuilder.initMap(hardwareMap);
068        driverGamepad = new CommandGamepad(gamepad1);
069        codriverGamepad = new CommandGamepad(gamepad2);
070        opModeTimer.reset();
071        uponInit();
072        logger = new Logger(this);
073        while (!(isStarted() && additionalInitConditions()) && !terminated && !isStopRequested()) {
074            initLoop();
075            universalLoop();
076            CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
077            logger.initUpdate();
078            driverGamepad.periodic();
079            codriverGamepad.periodic();
080            hubs.forEach(LynxModule::clearBulkCache);
081        }
082        opModeState = OpModeState.RUN;
083        CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
084        uponStart();
085        opModeTimer.reset();
086        while (opModeIsActive() && !terminated && !isStopRequested()) {
087            runLoop();
088            universalLoop();
089            CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
090            logger.runUpdate();
091            driverGamepad.periodic();
092            codriverGamepad.periodic();
093            hubs.forEach(LynxModule::clearBulkCache);
094        }
095        opModeState = OpModeState.END;
096        end();
097        CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
098        CommandScheduler.resetScheduler();
099        opModeTimer.reset();
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Runs once when op mode is initialized
104     */
105    public void uponInit() {}
106
107    /**
108     * Runs constantly when op mode is initialized, yet not started
109     */
110    public void initLoop() {}
111
112    /**
113     * Runs once when op mode is started
114     */
115    public void uponStart() {}
116
117    /**
118     * Runs constantly when op mode is started
119     */
120    public void runLoop() {}
121
122    /**
123     * Runs once when op mode is ended
124     */
125    public void end() {}
126
127    /**
128     * Runs constantly during all periods
129     */
130    public void universalLoop() {}
131
132    /**
133     * Enum for op mode state
134     */
135    public enum OpModeState {
136        INIT,
137        RUN,
138        END;
139
140        /**
141         * Check if other states are this state
142         *
143         * @param states The other states
144         * @return The above condition
145         */
146        public boolean isState(OpModeState... states) {
147            for (OpModeState s : states) {
148                if (this == s) {
149                    return true;
150                }
151            }
152            return false;
153        }
154    }
155
156    public void terminate() {
157        terminated = true;
158    }
159
160    public boolean additionalInitConditions() {
161        return true;
162    }
163}
